mean: A type of tree
examples: The oak tree is very old.
note: Commonly found in temperate zones.

mean: A type of flower
examples: She received a rose for her birthday.
note: Symbolizes love and beauty.

mean: A type of plant found in deserts
examples: Cacti are common in dry areas.
note: Stores water in its thick stem.

mean: A fast-growing grass
examples: Pandas eat bamboo.
note: Used in construction and furniture.

mean: A type of non-flowering plant
examples: Ferns grow well in shady areas.
note: Has feathery leaves.

mean: A community of people living together
examples: Society needs to care for its elderly.
note: Refers to a structured group of people.

mean: A group of related people
examples: Family is important to everyone.
note: Includes parents, children, and extended relatives.

mean: A close relationship between friends
examples: Their friendship lasted for decades.
note: Based on mutual affection.

mean: The arts and other manifestations of human intellectual achievement
examples: Culture includes traditions and customs.
note: Varies significantly between societies.

mean: A group of people living in the same area
examples: The community came together for the festival.
note: Often involves social interactions and shared spaces.

mean: The state of being free from illness
examples: Health is wealth.
note: Important for quality of life.

mean: A substance used for treating illness
examples: She took medicine for her cold.
note: Can be in various forms like pills or syrups.

mean: A person qualified to treat the sick
examples: The doctor examined the patient.
note: Requires extensive education and training.

mean: A place for medical treatment
examples: He was admitted to the hospital.
note: Provides healthcare services.

mean: A person trained to care for the sick
examples: The nurse gave me an injection.
note: Works alongside doctors in hospitals and clinics.

mean: A dish made of flat round bread with toppings
examples: They ordered a pizza for dinner.
note: Commonly topped with cheese and tomato sauce.

mean: A liquid dish typically made by boiling meat or vegetables
examples: He made chicken soup.
note: Can be served hot or cold.

mean: A sweet baked food made from flour, sugar, and other ingredients
examples: She baked a chocolate cake.
note: Often served on special occasions.

mean: A cold dish of mixed vegetables
examples: They had a salad for lunch.
note: Often served with a dressing.

mean: A sandwich consisting of a cooked patty of ground meat
examples: He ordered a cheeseburger.
note: Commonly served with fries.

mean: A piece of furniture for sitting on
examples: He sat on the chair.
note: Usually has four legs and a backrest.

mean: A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs
examples: They ate dinner at the table.
note: Can be used for various activities.

mean: A device for giving light
examples: She turned on the lamp.
note: Commonly used for reading.

mean: A device for measuring and showing time
examples: The clock struck twelve.
note: Can be found in homes and public places.

mean: A reflective surface, typically glass coated with a metal amalgam
examples: She looked at herself in the mirror.
note: Used for personal grooming and decoration.

mean: A small domesticated carnivorous mammal
examples: The cat slept on the couch.
note: Often kept as a pet.

mean: A domesticated carnivorous mammal
examples: The dog barked loudly.
note: Known for loyalty and companionship.

mean: A large carnivorous feline animal
examples: The lion roared in the zoo.
note: Often referred to as the king of the jungle.

mean: A large herbivorous mammal
examples: The elephant has a long trunk.
note: Largest land animal.

mean: A warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrate animal
examples: The bird sang beautifully.
note: Characterized by feathers and a beak.

mean: The practice or skill of preparing food
examples: She enjoys cooking.
note: Can be a hobby or profession.

mean: The control and operation of a motor vehicle
examples: He is good at driving.
note: Requires a license in most countries.

mean: The sport or activity of moving through water by moving your arms and legs
examples: Swimming is a good exercise.
note: Can be done for leisure or competition.

mean: The action or skill of writing by means of a typewriter or computer keyboard
examples: She learned typing in school.
note: Essential skill in the modern workplace.

mean: The activity of tending and cultivating a garden
examples: He loves gardening.
note: Involves growing plants and flowers.

mean: An electronic device for storing and processing data
examples: He bought a new computer.
note: Used in various fields and industries.

mean: A global computer network
examples: The internet is a vast resource of information.
note: Connects millions of private, public, academic, business, and government networks.

mean: The programs and other operating information used by a computer
examples: He installed new software.
note: Includes programs and applications.

mean: The physical parts of a computer
examples: He upgraded the hardware.
note: Includes the CPU, monitor, keyboard, etc.

mean: A process or set of rules to be followed in calculations
examples: The search algorithm was updated.
note: Used for solving problems and making decisions.

mean: The end part of a person's arm beyond the wrist
examples: She raised her hand.
note: Used for grasping and holding.

mean: The upper part of the human body
examples: He nodded his head.
note: Contains the brain, eyes, ears, nose, and mouth.

mean: Each of the limbs on which a person or animal walks
examples: He injured his leg.
note: Supports the body and allows for movement.

mean: A muscular organ that pumps blood
examples: His heart was beating fast.
note: Central to the circulatory system.

mean: An organ of vision
examples: She has blue eyes.
note: Allows for the perception of light and color.

mean: Activity involving mental or physical effort done to achieve a purpose
examples: He goes to work every day.
note: Can be paid or unpaid.

mean: A room or set of rooms where business or professional work is conducted
examples: She works in an office.
note: Can be located in various settings.

mean: A person responsible for controlling or administering an organization or group of staff
examples: The manager held a meeting.
note: Oversees operations and staff.

mean: A person employed for wages or salary
examples: The company has many employees.
note: Works under an employer.

mean: An individual or collaborative enterprise planned to achieve a particular aim
examples: They completed the project on time.
note: Often has a set timeline and goals.

mean: A story by a camera as a set of moving images
examples: They watched a movie together.
note: A form of entertainment.

mean: Vocal or instrumental sounds combined to produce harmony and expression of emotion
examples: He listens to music every day.
note: Can be performed solo or in a group.

mean: An activity that one engages in for amusement or fun
examples: They played a game of chess.
note: Can be physical or mental.

mean: A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together
examples: She borrowed a book from the library.
note: Can be fiction or nonfiction.

mean: A building or room containing collections of books
examples: He went to the library to study.
note: Often has facilities for reading and research.

mean: An institution providing medical and surgical treatment
examples: She was taken to the hospital.
note: Equipped to provide care for the sick or injured.

mean: An institution for educating children
examples: They go to school every day.
note: Provides primary and secondary education.

mean: A financial institution licensed to receive deposits and make loans
examples: She deposited money in the bank.
note: Offers various financial services.

mean: A building in which objects of historical, scientific, artistic, or cultural interest are stored and exhibited
examples: They visited the museum.
note: Preserves and displays artifacts and exhibits.

mean: A complex of runways and buildings for the takeoff, landing, and maintenance of civil aircraft
examples: They arrived at the airport early.
note: Includes terminals for passengers.

mean: A large public green area in a town, used for recreation
examples: They went for a walk in the park.
note: Often includes playgrounds and walking paths.

mean: A round fruit with red or green skin
examples: She ate an apple for lunch.
note: Can be eaten raw or used in cooking.

mean: A long curved fruit with a yellow skin
examples: He peeled the banana.
note: Rich in potassium.

mean: A tapering orange-colored root
examples: She chopped the carrot.
note: Often used in salads and cooking.

mean: A starchy plant tuber
examples: He mashed the potatoes.
note: Commonly used in cooking.

mean: A glossy red or yellow edible fruit
examples: They grew tomatoes in their garden.
note: Used in salads, sauces, and cooking.

mean: A domesticated bird kept for its eggs and meat
examples: They roasted a chicken.
note: A common source of protein.

mean: A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins
examples: They caught a fish.
note: Lives in water.

mean: Food made of flour, water, and yeast mixed together and baked
examples: He baked fresh bread.
note: A staple food in many cultures.

mean: A swamp grass cultivated as a source of food
examples: They cooked rice for dinner.
note: A staple food in many parts of the world.

mean: A white liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals
examples: He drank a glass of milk.
note: Commonly consumed by humans.

mean: A hot drink made by infusing the dried, crushed leaves of the tea plant in boiling water
examples: She brewed a cup of tea.
note: Can be served hot or cold.

mean: The liquid obtained from or present in fruit or vegetables
examples: He drank orange juice.
note: Commonly consumed as a beverage.

mean: A powered flying vehicle with fixed wings
examples: They boarded the airplane.
note: Used for transporting passengers and cargo.

mean: A large motor vehicle carrying passengers by road
examples: They took the bus to the city.
note: Common form of public transport.

mean: A series of connected vehicles that run on tracks
examples: They traveled by train.
note: Common form of transport for people and goods.

mean: A vehicle composed of two wheels held in a frame one behind the other
examples: She rode her bicycle to school.
note: Powered by pedaling.

mean: A road vehicle, typically with four wheels, powered by an internal combustion engine
examples: He drove his car to work.
note: Common form of personal transport.

mean: A small vessel for traveling over water
examples: They sailed the boat on the lake.
note: Used for recreation and transport.

mean: A large seagoing vessel
examples: The ship sailed across the ocean.
note: Used for transporting goods and passengers.

mean: A two-wheeled vehicle that is powered by a motor
examples: He rode his motorcycle to work.
note: Faster than a bicycle.

mean: The action of traveling or moving on foot
examples: They enjoy walking in the park.
note: A healthy form of exercise.

mean: A public road in a city or town
examples: They live on a quiet street.
note: Lined with buildings, homes, or trees.

mean: A building for human habitation
examples: They bought a new house.
note: Can be single-family or multi-family.

mean: A set of rooms forming an individual residence
examples: She lives in a small apartment.
note: Part of a larger building.

mean: A structure with a roof and walls
examples: They work in a tall building.
note: Can be residential, commercial, or industrial.

mean: A large town
examples: They moved to the city.
note: An urban area with a large population.

mean: A populated area smaller than a city
examples: They grew up in a small town.
note: Larger than a village but smaller than a city.

mean: A place where goods are sold to the public
examples: They went to the store to buy groceries.
note: Can be large or small, selling various goods.

mean: A large building or series of connected buildings containing a variety of retail stores
examples: They went to the mall to shop.
note: Often includes entertainment and dining options.

mean: A place where people pay to sit and eat meals
examples: They dined at a fancy restaurant.
note: Can be casual or formal.

mean: A large self-service store selling foods and household goods
examples: They went to the supermarket to buy groceries.
note: Offers a wide variety of products.

mean: The civil force of a state responsible for maintaining public order
examples: The police arrived quickly.
note: Responsible for enforcing the law.

mean: A building for the housing of firefighting equipment and personnel
examples: They visited the fire station.
note: Home base for firefighters.

mean: A building used for public Christian worship
examples: They went to church on Sunday.
note: A place for religious activities.

mean: A Muslim place of worship
examples: They prayed at the mosque.
note: A place for Islamic religious activities.

mean: A building devoted to the worship of a god or gods
examples: They visited the temple.
note: Can be found in various religious traditions.

mean: A building or part of a building where goods or services are sold
examples: She works in a shop.
note: Can sell a variety of products.

mean: An establishment providing accommodation, meals, and other services
examples: They stayed at a hotel.
note: Provides lodging for travelers.

mean: A pebbly or sandy shore by the ocean or a lake
examples: They relaxed on the beach.
note: Popular for swimming and sunbathing.

mean: A large area covered chiefly with trees and undergrowth
examples: They hiked through the forest.
note: Home to a variety of wildlife.

mean: A large natural elevation of the earth's surface
examples: They climbed the mountain.
note: Higher and steeper than a hill.

mean: A large natural stream of water flowing in a channel to the sea, a lake, or another river
examples: They fished in the river.
note: Can vary in size and speed of flow.

mean: A large body of water surrounded by land
examples: They swam in the lake.
note: Can be natural or man-made.

mean: A barren area of landscape where little precipitation occurs
examples: They traveled through the desert.
note: Can be hot or cold.

mean: A low area of land between hills or mountains
examples: They camped in the valley.
note: Often has a river running through it.

mean: A piece of land surrounded by water
examples: They vacationed on a tropical island.
note: Can be large or small.

mean: A very large expanse of sea
examples: They sailed across the ocean.
note: Covers most of the Earth's surface.

mean: A long body of water curling into an arched form and breaking on the shore
examples: They surfed on the waves.
note: Caused by wind, earthquakes, or tides.

mean: An area of open land
examples: They played soccer in the field.
note: Can be used for agriculture or sports.

mean: An area of land and its buildings, used for growing crops and rearing animals
examples: They live on a farm.
note: Can vary in size and type of production.

mean: The state of the atmosphere at a place and time
examples: The weather was sunny.
note: Includes temperature, wind, and precipitation.

mean: The star around which the earth orbits
examples: The sun was shining.
note: Provides light and warmth to the Earth.

mean: A visible mass of condensed water vapor floating in the atmosphere
examples: There were clouds in the sky.
note: Can indicate different weather conditions.

mean: Moisture condensed from the atmosphere that falls visibly in separate drops
examples: It started to rain.
note: A key part of the water cycle.

mean: Atmospheric water vapor frozen into ice crystals
examples: It started to snow.
note: Common in colder climates.

mean: The perceptible natural movement of the air
examples: The wind was strong.
note: Can vary in strength from a breeze to a hurricane.

mean: Extremely interesting or captivating
examples: The lecture was absolutely fascinating.
note: Arousing intense interest or admiration.

mean: Capturing the attention or interest of
examples: The book was so enthralling that I couldn't put it down.
note: Gripping and fascinating.

mean: Evoking interest, attention, or admiration in a powerfully irresistible way
examples: The movie had a compelling storyline.
note: Forcing one's attention or interest.

mean: Arousing one's curiosity or interest
examples: The mysterious stranger had an intriguing aura.
note: Provoking curiosity or interest; fascinating.

mean: Attracting and holding interest as if by a spell
examples: The children were captivated by the magician's performance.
note: Holding the attention by being extremely interesting, exciting, pleasant, or attractive.

mean: Achieving maximum productivity with minimum wasted effort or expense
examples: The new system is much more efficient than the old one.
note: Achieving maximum productivity with minimum wasted effort or expense.

mean: Yielding profit or financial gain
examples: The company has remained profitable despite the economic downturn.
note: Yielding profit or financial gain.

mean: Having or displaying a strong desire to be more successful than others
examples: She's very competitive and always wants to win.
note: Having or displaying a strong desire to be more successful than others.

mean: Relating to the identification of long-term or overall aims and interests and the means of achieving them
examples: The company is pursuing a strategic plan to expand its market share.
note: Relating to the identification of long-term or overall aims and interests and the means of achieving them.

mean: Skilled or competent in an activity or field
examples: She is proficient in three languages.
note: Highly skilled or experienced.

mean: A confusing or difficult problem or question
examples: The mystery presented a conundrum for detectives.
note: Requires careful consideration or analysis.

mean: The highest point or peak of achievement
examples: Winning the championship was the pinnacle of his career.
note: Represents the highest level of success.

mean: To be a typical example of something
examples: Her dedication exemplifies the company's values.
note: Serves as a perfect example or illustration.

mean: Present, appearing, or found everywhere
examples: Smartphones have become ubiquitous in modern society.
note: Seemingly everywhere at once.

mean: The flower of a plant, especially of one producing an edible fruit
examples: The cherry blossoms are in full bloom.
note: The colorful part of a plant where fruit develops.

mean: Plant leaves, collectively
examples: The dense foliage provided shade from the sun.
note: The leaves of a plant, considered collectively.

mean: A small stream or brook
examples: They went fishing in the creek.
note: A narrow, shallow stream of water.

mean: An ornamental cloth covering hung or held up over something
examples: The canopy provided shelter from the rain.
note: A covering usually providing protection or decoration.

mean: A tapering structure hanging like an icicle from the roof of a cave
examples: The cave was filled with impressive stalactites.
note: Formed from the ceiling of caves by the deposition of calcium salts.

mean: A group of people related by blood or marriage
examples: She comes from a large family.
note: Can include parents, siblings, and extended family.

mean: An intense feeling of deep affection
examples: They have a strong love for each other.
note: Can be romantic or platonic.

mean: The legally or formally recognized union of two people as partners in a personal relationship
examples: They celebrated their marriage with a ceremony.
note: Can involve legal and religious aspects.

mean: The legal dissolution of a marriage by a court or other competent body
examples: They went through a difficult divorce.
note: Can involve issues such as custody and alimony.

mean: A person's father or mother
examples: She's a devoted parent.
note: Responsible for the upbringing of a child.

mean: A garment for the upper body with a collar, sleeves, and buttons down the front
examples: He wore a clean white shirt.
note: Can be short-sleeved or long-sleeved.

mean: A garment covering the body from the waist to the ankles, with a separate part for each leg
examples: She put on a pair of black pants.
note: Also known as trousers or slacks.

mean: A one-piece garment for a woman or girl that covers the body and extends down over the legs
examples: She bought a new dress for the party.
note: Can be casual or formal.

mean: A set of matching outer garments, typically consisting of a jacket and trousers or a jacket and skirt
examples: He wore a tailored suit to the interview.
note: Often worn for formal occasions or business.

mean: An item added to one's outfit to complete the look
examples: She wore a scarf as an accessory.
note: Can include jewelry, hats, scarves, etc.

mean: A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side and bound in covers.
examples: She enjoys reading books.
note: Can be fiction or non-fiction.

mean: A person who teaches, especially in a school.
examples: He is a math teacher.
note: Instructs students in various subjects.

mean: A scientific procedure undertaken to make a discovery, test a hypothesis, or demonstrate a known fact.
examples: They conducted an experiment in the laboratory.
note: Can involve observation or manipulation of variables.

mean: An educational institution designed for instruction, examination, or both, of students in many branches of advanced learning.
examples: She attends the university.
note: Offers undergraduate and postgraduate degrees.

mean: The systematic investigation into and study of materials and sources in order to establish facts and reach new conclusions.
examples: They are conducting research on cancer treatment.
note: Can be scientific, academic, or market research.

mean: Vocal or instrumental sounds (or both) combined in such a way as to produce beauty of form, harmony, and expression of emotion.
examples: She enjoys listening to music.
note: Can be performed live or recorded.

mean: A series of moving images shown on a screen, typically with sound, that tell a story, record an event, or perform as an art form.
examples: They watched a film last night.
note: Can be fiction or non-fiction.

mean: Make a journey, typically of some length or abroad.
examples: They love to travel to exotic places.
note: Can be for leisure, business, or exploration.

mean: The expression or application of human creative skill and imagination, typically in a visual form such as painting or sculpture, producing works to be appreciated primarily for their beauty or emotional power.
examples: She is studying art history.
note: Includes various forms such as painting, sculpture, and architecture.

mean: The application of scientific knowledge for practical purposes, especially in industry.
examples: They work in the field of technology.
note: Includes computers, telecommunications, and robotics.
